trans-unit.source: HDInsight Hive Activity
trans-unit.target: HDInsight Hive Activity

trans-unit.source: This topic provides the JSON format that is supported by the July 2015 Release of Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: This topic provides the JSON format that is supported by the July 2015 Release of Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: If you are using an older version, see <link xlink:href="95596a66-6618-4a11-849a-492c4a0ddbcd" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">HDInsight Activity</link> for the old JSON format.
trans-unit.target: If you are using an older version, see <link xlink:href="95596a66-6618-4a11-849a-492c4a0ddbcd" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">HDInsight Activity</link> for the old JSON format.

trans-unit.source: This topic provides JSON syntax for using the <embeddedLabel>HDInsightHive</embeddedLabel> Activity to run Hive scripts on an HDInsight cluster from an Azure Data Factory pipeline.
trans-unit.target: This topic provides JSON syntax for using the <embeddedLabel>HDInsightHive</embeddedLabel> Activity to run Hive scripts on an HDInsight cluster from an Azure Data Factory pipeline.

trans-unit.source: It contains the following sections.
trans-unit.target: It contains the following sections.

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: The following JSON snippet shows the syntax for using the <embeddedLabel>HDInsightHive</embeddedLabel> Activity in a pipeline JSON file.
trans-unit.target: The following JSON snippet shows the syntax for using the <embeddedLabel>HDInsightHive</embeddedLabel> Activity in a pipeline JSON file.

trans-unit.source: Note the following:
trans-unit.target: Note the following:

trans-unit.source: Activity <embeddedLabel>type</embeddedLabel> is set to <embeddedLabel>HDInsightHive</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Activity <embeddedLabel>type</embeddedLabel> is set to <embeddedLabel>HDInsightHive</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>linkedServiceName</embeddedLabel> is set to <embeddedLabel>MyHDInsightLinkedService</embeddedLabel>, which links an HDInsight cluster to your Azure data factory.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>linkedServiceName</embeddedLabel> is set to <embeddedLabel>MyHDInsightLinkedService</embeddedLabel>, which links an HDInsight cluster to your Azure data factory.

trans-unit.source: You can specify the Hive script inline for the <embeddedLabel>script</embeddedLabel> property or store script files in an Azure blob storage and refer to the file using <embeddedLabel>scriptPath</embeddedLabel> property, which is explained later in this topic.
trans-unit.target: You can specify the Hive script inline for the <embeddedLabel>script</embeddedLabel> property or store script files in an Azure blob storage and refer to the file using <embeddedLabel>scriptPath</embeddedLabel> property, which is explained later in this topic.

trans-unit.source: You specify parameters for the Hive script by using the <embeddedLabel>extendedProperties</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: You specify parameters for the Hive script by using the <embeddedLabel>extendedProperties</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: More details are provided later in this topic.
trans-unit.target: More details are provided later in this topic.

trans-unit.source: The <embeddedLabel>getDebugInfo</embeddedLabel> property is an optional element.
trans-unit.target: The <embeddedLabel>getDebugInfo</embeddedLabel> property is an optional element.

trans-unit.source: When it is set to <embeddedLabel>Failure</embeddedLabel>, the logs are downloaded only on failure.
trans-unit.target: When it is set to <embeddedLabel>Failure</embeddedLabel>, the logs are downloaded only on failure.

trans-unit.source: When it is set to <embeddedLabel>All</embeddedLabel>, logs are always downloaded irrespective of the execution status.
trans-unit.target: When it is set to <embeddedLabel>All</embeddedLabel>, logs are always downloaded irrespective of the execution status.

trans-unit.source: Example
trans-unit.target: Example

trans-unit.source: When using a Hive activity, you can reference Hive scripts that are stored in Azure blob storage.
trans-unit.target: When using a Hive activity, you can reference Hive scripts that are stored in Azure blob storage.

trans-unit.source: The Azure storage account needs to be associated with the HDInsight cluster, in order for the Hive activity to be able to read the files during execution.
trans-unit.target: The Azure storage account needs to be associated with the HDInsight cluster, in order for the Hive activity to be able to read the files during execution.

trans-unit.source: The following properties need to be defined when referring to the script file.
trans-unit.target: The following properties need to be defined when referring to the script file.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>scriptPath</embeddedLabel> – Path to the Hive script file
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>scriptPath</embeddedLabel> – Path to the Hive script file

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>scriptLinkedService</embeddedLabel> – Azure storage account that contains the script file
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>scriptLinkedService</embeddedLabel> – Azure storage account that contains the script file

trans-unit.source: Example: Specifying parameters for a Hive script using extendedProperties
trans-unit.target: Example: Specifying parameters for a Hive script using extendedProperties

trans-unit.source: See the following example for specifying parameters for a Hive script using <embeddedLabel>extendedProperties</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: See the following example for specifying parameters for a Hive script using <embeddedLabel>extendedProperties</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: To use parameterized Hive scripts, do the following:
trans-unit.target: To use parameterized Hive scripts, do the following:

trans-unit.source: Define the parameters in <embeddedLabel>extendedProperties</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Define the parameters in <embeddedLabel>extendedProperties</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: In the Hive Script, refer to the parameter using <embeddedLabel>${hiveconf:parameterName}</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: In the Hive Script, refer to the parameter using <embeddedLabel>${hiveconf:parameterName}</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Other Activities
trans-unit.target: Other Activities

trans-unit.source: Use Pig and Hive with Azure Data Factory
trans-unit.target: Use Pig and Hive with Azure Data Factory
